title: Former White Sox pitcher, world champ Jenks dies
description: Bobby Jenks, 44, a former pitcher for the Chicago White Sox who was on the roster when the club won the 2005 World Series, died Friday in Sintra, Portugal, the team announced, months after being diagnosed with adenocarcinoma, a form of stomach cancer.

title: Rockets trade Whitmore to Wizards, sources say
description: The Houston Rockets are trading Cam Whitmore to the Washington Wizards for two second-round picks, sources told ESPN.
author: Shams Charania

title: England playing catch-up - what went wrong against France?
description: It did not go to plan in England's Euro 2025 opener as they fell to defeat by France - so where did it all go wrong?

title: 'Bazball's winning mantra facing biggest test of its resolve'
description: England face the first real test of their 'no-draws' approach, and coach Marcus Trescothick has hinted there may be room for manoeuvre.

title: Beaumont hails 'massive' win as Sciver-Brunt ruled out of T20 series
description: England's 'fight' helped them dig deep to claim a dramatic final-ball victory over India at The Kia Oval, but they will be without captain Nat Sciver-Brunt as they attempt to complete a comeback in the women's T20 series.

title: Smith, Brook launch stirring England fightback but India still well on top
description: Jamie Smith hit the highest score by an England Test wicketkeeper and threatened to smoke the team's fastest ton as he and Harry Brook led a stirring fightback against India - although the tourists remain in firm control at Edgbaston after a pulsating day three.

title: 2025 Indianapolis Colts roster preview: WR Anthony Gould
description: Let's take a closer look at this Indianapolis Colts team as we go player-by-player through the roster. Up next is WR Anthony Gould.

title: Rising PGA Tour Star Suddenly Withdraws From John Deere Classic Before Final Round
description: The third round of the John Deere Classic unfolded on Saturday, setting the stage for what could be a dramatic finish in Sundayâ€™s final round, with several players still firmly in contention. Brian Campbell, Emiliano Grillo, David Lipsky, and Max Homa are all tied for second at 14-under, just one shot back. Four players pulled out before the event even began, and since then, Andrew Putnam, Nicholas Lindheim, and Stephan Jaeger have all withdrawn mid-tournament.
